about_the_game:
This is a collection of retro RPG-style BGM reminiscent of 8-bit pixel retro RPGs from the 1990s.

These tracks were created from samples of actual game consoles from the 1990s, and the number of notes produced for the BGM were mostly limited to the number of notes realistically rendered in the 90s to stay true to the theme of the times.
(There are some exceptional compositions to the above that exceed the number of notes due to necessary sound reverb adjustments, etc.)

In addition to general-purpose orchestral music, the album also includes regional and ethnic music that reflects a world tour, as the name "World" implies.
This includes atmospheric themes like Bossa nova, flamenco, Arabian, tropical music, science fiction, Japanese, snow country, desert, etc. which evoke thematic ambience.

The collection also includes battle songs with different climaxes from the small battles to the final stage battles, and songs for villages, towns, dungeons, and scenes with many different atmospheres, in a way that a full-length RPG can be completed using only this collection of materials, The title screen and ending music, field music, and music for small boats, large ships, airships, and other variations of ships are all included in this collection.

With a total of 79 tracks (76 BGM and 3 ME), it can be used as a basic set of retro RPG-style BGM, or to supplement a wide range of tracks in game production.


●Set Contents
BGM 76 items
　　Battle: 4 tracks
　　Castle: 3 tracks
　　Dungeon: 15 tracks
　　Title: 2 tracks
　　Ending: 1 track
　　Field: 3 tracks
　　Scene: 22 tracks
　　Science fiction: 2 tracks
　　Ship: 3 tracks
　　Town: 21 tracks

ME: 3 points
　　Game over: 1 track
　　Innkeeper: 1 track
　　Victory: 1 track

Each track is recorded in both ogg and m4a formats.
Loop points are not used, and the BGM is adjusted to loop throughout the file. Therefore, even in environments that do not support loop points, it will loop as usual.

--------------------------------

・This pack is for use in RPG Maker Series or the engine of your choice.
・OK to be used in Commercial projects made in RPG Maker
・You may modify some of the assets (but not redistribute them) for your own game use only.
detailed_description:
This is a collection of retro RPG-style BGM reminiscent of 8-bit pixel retro RPGs from the 1990s.

These tracks were created from samples of actual game consoles from the 1990s, and the number of notes produced for the BGM were mostly limited to the number of notes realistically rendered in the 90s to stay true to the theme of the times.
(There are some exceptional compositions to the above that exceed the number of notes due to necessary sound reverb adjustments, etc.)

In addition to general-purpose orchestral music, the album also includes regional and ethnic music that reflects a world tour, as the name "World" implies.
This includes atmospheric themes like Bossa nova, flamenco, Arabian, tropical music, science fiction, Japanese, snow country, desert, etc. which evoke thematic ambience.

The collection also includes battle songs with different climaxes from the small battles to the final stage battles, and songs for villages, towns, dungeons, and scenes with many different atmospheres, in a way that a full-length RPG can be completed using only this collection of materials, The title screen and ending music, field music, and music for small boats, large ships, airships, and other variations of ships are all included in this collection.

With a total of 79 tracks (76 BGM and 3 ME), it can be used as a basic set of retro RPG-style BGM, or to supplement a wide range of tracks in game production.

Each track is recorded in both ogg and m4a formats.
